text:
="preserve">Donald Francis Whiston (June 19, 1927 – July 11, 2020) was an American ice hockey player. He won a silver medal at the 1952 Winter Olympics. Afterwards he coached at Brown for three seasons. Whiston was born in Lynn, Massachusetts.
Whiston died on July 11, 2020 in Ipswich, Massachusetts at the age of 93.
